reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Caribbean Sustainable Energy Forum C-SEF III

description.narrative: The Caribbean Community CARICOM Secretariat organizes the Third Caribbean Sustainable Energy Forum (C-SEF III) for CARICOM countries with support from external partners in Saint Kitts and Nevis on 13-14 September 2012. The objective of the conference is to gather together the central actors in the field of renewable energy in the Caribbean as well as to discuss countries' needs and developing the regional energy policy. The conference contributes to the implementation of the CARICOM Energy Programme. Develo ping renewable energy is a key priority for CARICOM and its member states. Finland's objective is to support energy sector cooperation between the countries in the region by promoting dialogue in the political and technical level. In this way Finland suppo rts climate sustainability sustainable energy planning and energy self-sufficiency and promotes the use of renewable energy and energy efficiency. Sustainable energy access is included in Finland's Development Policy Programme 2012. Finland supports organi zing the conference with 117 500 euros as part of her cooperation with the Caribbean region.
